<!-- DO NOT EDIT: Generated by cmd/docs/errors; run 'go generate ./...' -->
# Error Codes

<a id="eve-101-1"></a>
## EVE-101-1

- Exit code: `101`
- CLI message: `no command specified`
- Guidance: No subcommand was provided. Specify a valid subcommand: `sync`, `diff`, `validate`, or `version`. See `envseed --help` for an overview and `envseed <command> --help` for usage.

<a id="eve-101-2"></a>
## EVE-101-2

- Exit code: `101`
- CLI message: `unknown command %q`
- Guidance: An unsupported subcommand was provided. Use a valid subcommand: `sync`, `diff`, `validate`, or `version`. See `envseed --help` and `envseed <command> --help` for usage.

<a id="eve-101-3"></a>
## EVE-101-3

- Exit code: `101`
- CLI message: `unsupported flag combination`
- Guidance: The provided flags conflict or are not supported together. Remove the conflicting flags. See `envseed <command> --help` for supported combinations.

<a id="eve-101-4"></a>
## EVE-101-4

- Exit code: `101`
- CLI message: `version command does not accept flags or arguments`
- Guidance: Flags or arguments were provided to `version`. Run `envseed version` with no flags or arguments. See `envseed version --help` for details.

<a id="eve-101-5"></a>
## EVE-101-5

- Exit code: `101`
- CLI message: `unknown or invalid flag %q`
- Guidance: An unknown or invalid flag was provided. Remove or correct the flag. See `envseed <command> --help` for supported options.

<a id="eve-101-6"></a>
## EVE-101-6

- Exit code: `101`
- CLI message: `unexpected positional arguments`
- Guidance: Too many positional arguments were provided. Provide at most one optional INPUT_FILE.

<a id="eve-101-101"></a>
## EVE-101-101

- Exit code: `101`
- CLI message: `stdin is not supported`
- Guidance: This command intentionally does not accept stdin for templates for safety and reproducibility. Provide a readable file path instead of stdin. See `envseed <command> --help` for argument usage.

<a id="eve-101-201"></a>
## EVE-101-201

- Exit code: `101`
- CLI message: ``input file %q must contain `envseed` when `--output` is omitted``
- Guidance: Omitting `--output` requires the template filename to contain `envseed`. Include `envseed` in the template filename or supply `--output`. See `envseed <command> --help` for usage.

<a id="eve-101-301"></a>
## EVE-101-301

- Exit code: `101`
- CLI message: `output path %q is a directory`
- Guidance: The output path resolves to a directory. Choose a path that resolves to a regular file. Specify the output file explicitly with `--output` when needed.

<a id="eve-102-1"></a>
## EVE-102-1

- Exit code: `102`
- CLI message: `selected input %q not found`
- Guidance: The selected input does not exist (ENOENT). Verify the path or create the file.

<a id="eve-102-2"></a>
## EVE-102-2

- Exit code: `102`
- CLI message: `selected input %q is a directory`
- Guidance: The selected input resolves to a directory (EISDIR). Provide a readable regular file.

<a id="eve-102-3"></a>
## EVE-102-3

- Exit code: `102`
- CLI message: `selected input %q path component is not a directory`
- Guidance: One or more path components are not directories (ENOTDIR). Fix the path structure.

<a id="eve-102-4"></a>
## EVE-102-4

- Exit code: `102`
- CLI message: `selected input %q symlink loop detected`
- Guidance: A symbolic link loop prevents resolving the selected input (ELOOP). Fix the links.

<a id="eve-102-5"></a>
## EVE-102-5

- Exit code: `102`
- CLI message: `selected input %q name too long`
- Guidance: The path or filename exceeds the length limit (ENAMETOOLONG). Shorten the path or filename.

<a id="eve-102-101"></a>
## EVE-102-101

- Exit code: `102`
- CLI message: `permission denied reading %q`
- Guidance: Reading the file was denied by the operating system. Check file ownership and read permissions, or run with sufficient privileges.

<a id="eve-102-201"></a>
## EVE-102-201

- Exit code: `102`
- CLI message: `open failed for selected input %q`
- Guidance: Opening the selected input failed due to resource exhaustion or other OS-level errors.

<a id="eve-102-202"></a>
## EVE-102-202

- Exit code: `102`
- CLI message: `I/O error reading selected input %q`
- Guidance: Reading the selected input failed (e.g., EIO). Try again or check the media.

<a id="eve-102-203"></a>
## EVE-102-203

- Exit code: `102`
- CLI message: `failed to read template file %q`
- Guidance: An unspecified I/O error occurred while accessing the selected input.

<a id="eve-103-1"></a>
## EVE-103-1

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: ``non-ASCII whitespace around placeholder separators or before `>```
- Guidance: Non‑ASCII whitespace was detected around `|`, `,`, or before `>`. Use ASCII SPACE or TAB only. For example: NG: `<pass:api_key | base64>`. OK: `<pass:api_key|base64>`.

<a id="eve-103-2"></a>
## EVE-103-2

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `non-ASCII whitespace adjacent to placeholder PATH`
- Guidance: Non‑ASCII whitespace was detected adjacent to the placeholder path. Use ASCII SPACE or TAB only when trimming around the placeholder path. For example: NG uses U+00A0 between `:` and `api_key`: `<pass:api_key|...>`. OK: `<pass:api_key|...>`.

<a id="eve-103-3"></a>
## EVE-103-3

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `non-ASCII whitespace at start of line`
- Guidance: Leading whitespace contains non‑ASCII characters. Use ASCII SPACE or TAB only and avoid Unicode spaces such as U+00A0.

<a id="eve-103-4"></a>
## EVE-103-4

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: ``whitespace between `pass` and `:```
- Guidance: Whitespace was inserted between `pass` and `:`. Do not add whitespace there. For example: NG: `<pass :path|...>`. OK: `<pass:path|...>`.

<a id="eve-103-101"></a>
## EVE-103-101

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `invalid assignment name`
- Guidance: The assignment name is invalid. Use ASCII letters, digits, or underscore, and do not leave the name empty. For example: valid `FOO_1`. Invalid `1FOO`.

<a id="eve-103-102"></a>
## EVE-103-102

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `missing '=' in assignment`
- Guidance: The assignment is missing `=` or `+=` between name and value. Ensure the operator is present. For example: NG: `NAME value`. OK: `NAME=value`.

<a id="eve-103-103"></a>
## EVE-103-103

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `unexpected line; expected an assignment`
- Guidance: A non‑blank line is neither an assignment nor a comment. Each non‑blank line must be an assignment or a comment; blank lines are allowed.

<a id="eve-103-201"></a>
## EVE-103-201

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `empty placeholder path`
- Guidance: The placeholder path is empty. Provide a non‑empty path inside `<pass:...>`. For example: NG: `<pass:|...>`. OK: `<pass:secret/path|...>`.

<a id="eve-103-202"></a>
## EVE-103-202

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `unterminated placeholder`
- Guidance: The placeholder is unterminated. Close placeholders with `>` and ensure all modifiers are complete. For example: NG: `<pass:api_key|allow_newline`. OK: `<pass:api_key|allow_newline>`.

<a id="eve-103-203"></a>
## EVE-103-203

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `placeholder path contains NUL byte`
- Guidance: The placeholder path contains a NUL byte. Remove NUL bytes U+0000 from the path.

<a id="eve-103-204"></a>
## EVE-103-204

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `placeholder path contains non-ASCII whitespace`
- Guidance: Non‑ASCII whitespace was found around the placeholder path. Use ASCII SPACE or TAB only.

<a id="eve-103-205"></a>
## EVE-103-205

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `template contains NUL byte`
- Guidance: The template contains a NUL byte (U+0000). Remove NUL bytes from the input.

<a id="eve-103-301"></a>
## EVE-103-301

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `missing placeholder modifiers after '|'`
- Guidance: The `|` separator was present but no modifiers were provided after it. List at least one modifier after `|`. For example: `<pass:api_key|allow_newline>`.

<a id="eve-103-302"></a>
## EVE-103-302

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `unknown placeholder modifier %q`
- Guidance: An unknown placeholder modifier was provided. Use only supported modifiers: `allow_newline`, `allow_tab`, `base64`, `strip`, `strip_left`, `strip_right`, `dangerously_bypass_escape`.

<a id="eve-103-303"></a>
## EVE-103-303

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `duplicate placeholder modifier %q`
- Guidance: A placeholder modifier was repeated. Specify each modifier at most once. For example: NG: `<pass:api_key|strip,strip>`. OK: `<pass:api_key|strip>`.

<a id="eve-103-304"></a>
## EVE-103-304

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `empty placeholder modifier`
- Guidance: An empty placeholder modifier was found. Remove empty entries between commas. For example: NG: `<pass:api_key|strip,,base64>`.

<a id="eve-103-305"></a>
## EVE-103-305

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `invalid whitespace or NUL byte in placeholder modifiers`
- Guidance: Invalid whitespace or NUL bytes were found in placeholder modifiers. Use ASCII SPACE or TAB only and remove NUL bytes.

<a id="eve-103-401"></a>
## EVE-103-401

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `unterminated double quote`
- Guidance: A double‑quoted string is unterminated. Close the string before the line ends. For example: NG: `NAME="value`.

<a id="eve-103-402"></a>
## EVE-103-402

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `unterminated single quote`
- Guidance: A single‑quoted string is unterminated. Close the string before the line ends. For example: NG: `NAME='value`.

<a id="eve-103-403"></a>
## EVE-103-403

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `unterminated backtick substitution`
- Guidance: A backtick command substitution is unterminated. Close the substitution. For example: NG: `` NAME=`cmd `.

<a id="eve-103-404"></a>
## EVE-103-404

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `unterminated command substitution`
- Guidance: A `$()` command substitution is unterminated. Ensure the opening and closing parentheses match. For example: NG: `NAME=$(cmd`.

<a id="eve-103-501"></a>
## EVE-103-501

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: `mismatched brackets in assignment name`
- Guidance: Brackets in the assignment name are mismatched. Balance `[` and `]`. For example: NG: `ARR[0=value`.

<a id="eve-103-502"></a>
## EVE-103-502

- Exit code: `103`
- CLI message: ``unexpected `]` in assignment``
- Guidance: An unexpected `]` was found in the assignment name. Check bracket usage. For example: NG: `ARR]0=value`.

<a id="eve-104-1"></a>
## EVE-104-1

- Exit code: `104`
- CLI message: `pass command not found`
- Guidance: The `pass` CLI is not available. Install `pass` and ensure it is available in `PATH`.

<a id="eve-104-101"></a>
## EVE-104-101

- Exit code: `104`
- CLI message: `pass show %q failed`
- Guidance: The `pass` command returned an error for the requested entry. Run `pass show <PATH>` to see the underlying cause and resolve the issue such as a missing entry or a permission error.

<a id="eve-104-201"></a>
## EVE-104-201

- Exit code: `104`
- CLI message: `pass entry %q not found`
- Guidance: The requested `pass` entry was not found. Create the entry or correct the placeholder path. For example: `pass insert <PATH>`.

<a id="eve-104-301"></a>
## EVE-104-301

- Exit code: `104`
- CLI message: `pass entry %q contains NUL byte`
- Guidance: The `pass` entry value contains a NUL byte. Remove NUL characters U+0000 from the value.

<a id="eve-105-1"></a>
## EVE-105-1

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `rendering failed due to placeholder constraints`
- Guidance: The secret cannot be represented in the chosen placeholder context without violating constraints. Adjust quoting or add the required modifiers such as `allow_newline` or `allow_tab`, or choose a different quoting context.

<a id="eve-105-101"></a>
## EVE-105-101

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: ``single-quoted placeholder cannot contain a single quote (`'`)``
- Guidance: Single quotes cannot contain `'`. Switch to double quotes; escaping is applied automatically in double‑quoted context.

<a id="eve-105-102"></a>
## EVE-105-102

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `newline not permitted in single-quoted placeholder`
- Guidance: Newlines are not permitted in single‑quoted placeholders. Switch to double quotes and add the `allow_newline` modifier.

<a id="eve-105-103"></a>
## EVE-105-103

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `TAB not permitted in single-quoted placeholder`
- Guidance: TAB is not permitted in single‑quoted placeholders. Add the `allow_tab` modifier or switch to double quotes with `allow_tab`.

<a id="eve-105-104"></a>
## EVE-105-104

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `control character U+%04X not permitted in single-quoted placeholder`
- Guidance: Control characters are not supported in single‑quoted placeholders. Switch to double quotes or adjust the value.

<a id="eve-105-105"></a>
## EVE-105-105

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `allow_newline modifier is not supported in single-quoted context`
- Guidance: The `allow_newline` modifier is not supported in single‑quoted context. Switch to double quotes and add the `allow_newline` modifier.

<a id="eve-105-201"></a>
## EVE-105-201

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `newline not permitted in double-quoted placeholder`
- Guidance: Newlines are not permitted in double‑quoted placeholders by default. Add the `allow_newline` modifier.

<a id="eve-105-202"></a>
## EVE-105-202

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `TAB not permitted in double-quoted placeholder`
- Guidance: TAB is not permitted in double‑quoted placeholders by default. Add the `allow_tab` modifier.

<a id="eve-105-203"></a>
## EVE-105-203

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `control character U+%04X not permitted in double-quoted placeholder`
- Guidance: Control characters are not supported in double‑quoted placeholders. Adjust the value or encoding.

<a id="eve-105-301"></a>
## EVE-105-301

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `newline not permitted in command substitution placeholder`
- Guidance: Newlines are not permitted in command substitution placeholders by default. Add the `allow_newline` modifier.

<a id="eve-105-302"></a>
## EVE-105-302

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `TAB not permitted in command substitution placeholder`
- Guidance: TAB is not permitted in command substitution placeholders by default. Add the `allow_tab` modifier.

<a id="eve-105-303"></a>
## EVE-105-303

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `control character U+%04X not permitted in command substitution placeholder`
- Guidance: Control characters are not supported in command substitution placeholders. Adjust the value.

<a id="eve-105-401"></a>
## EVE-105-401

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `newline not permitted in backtick placeholder`
- Guidance: Newlines are not permitted in backtick placeholders. Replace backticks with `$()` and add the `allow_newline` modifier if needed.

<a id="eve-105-402"></a>
## EVE-105-402

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `TAB not permitted in backtick placeholder`
- Guidance: TAB is not permitted in backtick placeholders. Add the `allow_tab` modifier or switch to a different quoting context.

<a id="eve-105-403"></a>
## EVE-105-403

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `control character U+%04X not permitted in backtick placeholder`
- Guidance: Control characters are not supported in backtick placeholders. Adjust the value.

<a id="eve-105-404"></a>
## EVE-105-404

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `allow_newline modifier is not supported in backtick context`
- Guidance: The `allow_newline` modifier is not supported in backtick context. Replace backticks with `$()` and use `allow_newline`.

<a id="eve-105-501"></a>
## EVE-105-501

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `newline not permitted in bare placeholder`
- Guidance: Newlines are not permitted in bare placeholders. Switch to double quotes and add the `allow_newline` modifier.

<a id="eve-105-502"></a>
## EVE-105-502

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `TAB not permitted in bare placeholder`
- Guidance: TAB is not permitted in bare placeholders. Switch to double quotes or add the `allow_tab` modifier.

<a id="eve-105-503"></a>
## EVE-105-503

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `control character U+%04X not permitted in bare placeholder`
- Guidance: Control characters are not supported in bare placeholders. Quote or encode the value to avoid emitting unsupported control characters.

<a id="eve-105-504"></a>
## EVE-105-504

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `allow_newline modifier is not supported in bare context`
- Guidance: The `allow_newline` modifier is not supported in bare context. Switch to double quotes and add the `allow_newline` modifier.

<a id="eve-105-601"></a>
## EVE-105-601

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `invalid placeholder modifier combination`
- Guidance: The `base64` modifier cannot be combined with any other modifier. Remove the other modifiers, including the strip family and `dangerously_bypass_escape`.

<a id="eve-105-701"></a>
## EVE-105-701

- Exit code: `105`
- CLI message: `rendered output is syntactically invalid`
- Guidance: The rendered output is syntactically invalid. Ensure the rendered assignments are syntactically valid and review any use of `dangerously_bypass_escape`.

<a id="eve-106-1"></a>
## EVE-106-1

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `output directory %q does not exist`
- Guidance: The output directory does not exist. Create the directory before running `envseed`.

<a id="eve-106-2"></a>
## EVE-106-2

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `failed to access output directory %q`
- Guidance: The output directory could not be accessed. Check directory permissions and ensure `envseed` can access the target directory.

<a id="eve-106-3"></a>
## EVE-106-3

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `output path parent %q is not a directory`
- Guidance: The parent of the output path is not a directory. Select an output path whose parent is a directory.

<a id="eve-106-4"></a>
## EVE-106-4

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `failed to stat output file %q`
- Guidance: The output path could not be inspected. Investigate filesystem issues that prevent `envseed` from statting the path.

<a id="eve-106-101"></a>
## EVE-106-101

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `output file %q already exists`
- Guidance: The output file already exists. Use `--force` when you intend to replace the existing file.

<a id="eve-106-102"></a>
## EVE-106-102

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `failed to read output file %q`
- Guidance: Reading the existing output file failed. Resolve permission or locking problems before reading or writing.

<a id="eve-106-103"></a>
## EVE-106-103

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `failed to set file mode on output file %q`
- Guidance: Setting the file mode on the output file failed. Ensure `envseed` has permission to change the mode to `0600`.

<a id="eve-106-201"></a>
## EVE-106-201

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `failed to create temporary output file in %q`
- Guidance: Creating a temporary output file failed. Check directory permissions and available disk space.

<a id="eve-106-202"></a>
## EVE-106-202

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `failed to set file mode on temporary output file %q`
- Guidance: Setting the file mode on the temporary output file failed. Ensure the filesystem permits mode `0600` for temporary files.

<a id="eve-106-203"></a>
## EVE-106-203

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `failed to write temporary output file %q`
- Guidance: Writing the temporary output file failed. Resolve disk or permission issues that prevent writing the rendered content.

<a id="eve-106-204"></a>
## EVE-106-204

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `failed to close temporary output file %q`
- Guidance: Closing the temporary output file failed. Investigate filesystem issues causing failures on file close.

<a id="eve-106-301"></a>
## EVE-106-301

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `failed to replace %q with %q atomically`
- Guidance: Atomic replacement failed during rename. Fix rename failures, which are often due to cross‑filesystem moves or permissions.

<a id="eve-106-302"></a>
## EVE-106-302

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `failed to set permissions on %q`
- Guidance: Setting permissions on the output file failed. Ensure `envseed` can `chmod` the file to `0600`.

<a id="eve-106-401"></a>
## EVE-106-401

- Exit code: `106`
- CLI message: `failed to write dry-run output`
- Guidance: Writing dry‑run output to stdout failed. Resolve stdout write failures when running with `--dry-run`.

<a id="eve-107-1"></a>
## EVE-107-1

- Exit code: `107`
- CLI message: `unsupported line in target .env`
- Guidance: An unsupported line was found in the target `.env`. Only assignments, comments, and blank lines are allowed.

<a id="eve-107-101"></a>
## EVE-107-101

- Exit code: `107`
- CLI message: `target .env contains non-ASCII whitespace at the beginning of the line before the assignment`
- Guidance: Non‑ASCII whitespace was found at the beginning of an assignment line (indentation). Use ASCII SPACE or TAB only in that position. For example: NG uses U+00A0 before `APP_PORT=8080`: `\u00A0APP_PORT=8080`. OK: ` APP_PORT=8080` or `\tAPP_PORT=8080`.

<a id="eve-107-102"></a>
## EVE-107-102

- Exit code: `107`
- CLI message: `target .env contains NUL byte`
- Guidance: A NUL byte was found in the target `.env`. Remove NUL bytes U+0000 from the file.

<a id="eve-107-201"></a>
## EVE-107-201

- Exit code: `107`
- CLI message: `unterminated double quote in target .env`
- Guidance: A double‑quoted string is unterminated in the target `.env`. Close the string before the line ends. For example: NG: `NAME="value`.

<a id="eve-107-202"></a>
## EVE-107-202

- Exit code: `107`
- CLI message: `unterminated single quote in target .env`
- Guidance: A single‑quoted string is unterminated in the target `.env`. Close the string before the line ends. For example: NG: `NAME='value`.

<a id="eve-107-203"></a>
## EVE-107-203

- Exit code: `107`
- CLI message: `unterminated backtick substitution in target .env`
- Guidance: A backtick command substitution is unterminated in the target `.env`. Close the substitution. For example: NG: `` NAME=`cmd `.

<a id="eve-107-204"></a>
## EVE-107-204

- Exit code: `107`
- CLI message: `unterminated command substitution in target .env`
- Guidance: A `$()` command substitution is unterminated in the target `.env`. Ensure the opening and closing parentheses match. For example: NG: `NAME=$(cmd`.

<a id="eve-107-205"></a>
## EVE-107-205

- Exit code: `107`
- CLI message: `invalid syntax in target .env`
- Guidance: The target `.env` contains invalid syntax. Ensure it follows the same grammar as the template, allowing assignments, comments, and blank lines only.

<a id="eve-107-301"></a>
## EVE-107-301

- Exit code: `107`
- CLI message: `placeholders are not allowed in target .env`
- Guidance: Placeholders are not allowed in the target `.env`. Remove constructs such as `<pass:...>`.

<a id="eve-108-1"></a>
## EVE-108-1

- Exit code: `108`
- CLI message: `diff target %q exceeds 10 MiB size limit`
- Guidance: The target file exceeds the 10 MiB diff size limit. Reduce the file size or split the environment file before running `envseed diff`.

<a id="eve-108-2"></a>
## EVE-108-2

- Exit code: `108`
- CLI message: `failed to build diff for %q`
- Guidance: Building the diff failed. Inspect filesystem permissions and retry the diff operation.

<a id="eve-108-3"></a>
## EVE-108-3

- Exit code: `108`
- CLI message: `failed to write diff for %q`
- Guidance: Writing the diff failed. Ensure stdout accepts diff output and rerun `envseed diff`.

<a id="eve-199-1"></a>
## EVE-199-1

- Exit code: `199`
- CLI message: `redaction failed (internal error)`
- Guidance: Redaction rendering failed due to an internal error. Please report this bug and include reproducible steps.

<a id="eve-199-2"></a>
## EVE-199-2

- Exit code: `199`
- CLI message: `resolver used after close`
- Guidance: The resolver was used after it was closed. Please report this bug and include reproducible steps.
